com.tombarrasso.android.wp7ui.app
Class WPActivity

java.lang.Object
  Activity
      com.tombarrasso.android.wp7ui.app.WPActivity
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.tombarrasso.android.wp7ui.view.WPContextMenu.OnContextItemSelectedListener, com.tombarrasso.android.wp7ui.view.WPMenu.OnMenuItemSelectedListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
WPListActivity
public class WPActivity
extends Activity
implements com.tombarrasso.android.wp7ui.view.WPMenu.OnMenuItemSelectedListener, com.tombarrasso.android.wp7ui.view.WPContextMenu.OnContextItemSelectedListener

Extend from WPActivity instead of WPActivity to include boilerplate code necessary for UI features like an under-finger context menu, AppBar system menu, etc. See HomeActivity for example implementation.

Change log:
Version 1.01

  • Custom Window Animations (in Java)
Version 1.02
  • Fixed memory leak with configuration changes.
  • Saved state (keep menus open after orientation change).
Version 1.03
  • Fixed scary logcat output about status bar broadcast receivers.
  • Fixed unchecked compile time warning.
Version 1.04
  • Added more optins to control the flow of WPActivity such as when to consume key events and such.

Since:
04-10-2012

setActivityAnimation

public void setActivityAnimation(Animation in,
                                 Animation out)
Define custom animations to be used during Activity transitions such as an Activity being finished. There are two animations for an in/ out transition. By calling this method window animations will be handled by WPActivity automatically instead of being handled by the default implementation.

Parameters:
in - The animation to be used when this Activity is brought into view.
out - The animation to be used when this Activity finishes/ stops.

setActivityInAnimation

public void setActivityInAnimation(Animation in)
Set the animation to be used when an Activity transitions in, such as the next Activity finishing.

Note: This method is provided to allow for overriding a previous set activity animation. Both an in/ out animation must be set for window animations to function properly.

Parameters:
in - The animation to be used when this Activity is brought into view.

setActivityOutAnimation

public void setActivityOutAnimation(Animation out)
Set the animation to be used when an Activity transitions out, such as this Activity finishing or another Activity being started.

Note: This method is provided to allow for overriding a previous set activity animation. Both an in/ out animation must be set for window animations to function properly.

Parameters:
out - The animation to be used when this Activity finishes/ stops.

removeActivityAnimation

public void removeActivityAnimation()
Removes custom Activity animations if set.

getActivityOutAnimation

public Animation getActivityOutAnimation()
Returns:
The animation to be used for transitioning this Activity out.

getActivityInAnimation

public Animation getActivityInAnimation()
Returns:
The animation to be used for transitioning this Activity in.

finishNow

Finish right now! No animation.

finish

public void finish()

onRetainNonConfigurationInstance

public java.lang.Object onRetainNonConfigurationInstance()
To detect the difference between a configuration change and an Activity being closed/ started this MUST NOT RETURN NULL. More importantly this data MUST BE SAVED TO RESTORE STATE meaning to keep menus open if they were previously. Make a call to restoreFromState with the value that this method returns.

getState

protected java.lang.Object getState()
Returns:
The current state including whether or not menus are displaying.

onStart

protected void onStart()

onPause

protected void onPause()
Menus, context menus, and listeners used by the status bar are removed here to prevent scary-looking albeit harmless calls put out to the log.

restoreFromState

public void restoreFromState(WPActivity.State mState)
Restores the state of the WPActivity to a previous state, ie. to keep menus that were previously open open, etc. The return value of WPActivity.onRetainNonConfigurationInstance is what should be passed to this method.

Parameters:
mState - The state from which to restore to.

onLowMemory

public void onLowMemory()
